t: Job 7
Isn’t*pn each person consigned to forced labor on earth? Are*ln not his days like those of a hired worker?
Like*ln a slave he longs for shade; like*ln a hired worker he waits for his pay.
So*ln I have been made to inherit months of futility, and*ln troubled nights have been assigned to me.
When*ln I lie down I think, “When*ln will I get up?” But*ln the evening drags on endlessly, and*ln I toss and turn until dawn.
My*ln flesh is clothed with maggots and encrusted with dirt. My*ln skin forms scabs and then oozes.
My*pn days pass more swiftly than a weaver’s shuttle; they*ln come to an end without hope.
Remember*ln that my life is but a breath. My*ln eye will never again see anything good.
The*ln eye of anyone who looks on me will*ln no longer see me. Your*ln eyes will look for me, but I will be gone.
As*ln a cloud fades away and vanishes, so*ln the one who goes down to Sheol will never rise again.
He*ln will never return to his house; his*ln hometown will no longer remember him.
Therefore*pn I will not restrain my mouth. I*ln will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I*ln will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
Am*ln I the sea or a sea monster, that*ln you keep me under guard?
When*ln I say, “My bed will comfort me, and*ln my couch will ease my complaint,”
then*ln you frighten me with dreams, and*ln terrify me with visions,
so*ln that I prefer strangling— death*ln rather than life in this body.
I*ln give up! I will not live forever. Leave*ln me alone, for my days are a breath.
What*pn is a mere human, that you think so highly of him and*ln pay so much attention to him?
You*ln inspect him every morning, and*ln put him to the test every moment.
Will*ln you ever look away from me, or*ln leave me alone long enough to swallow?
If*ln I have sinned, what have I done to you, Watcher*ln of humanity? Why*ln have you made me your target, so*ln that I have become a burden to you?
Why*ln not forgive my sin and*ln pardon my iniquity? For*ln soon I will lie down in the grave. You*ln will eagerly seek me, but I will be gone.
